Attributes¶

Data.data_dictionary¶

Dictionary used by the DnnLik and DnnLikEnsemble objects to keep track and store on the RAM the generated train/validation/test data (used, for instance, when training the DNNLikelihood and in making predictions). The dictionary is updated each time data are generated or updated and is not stored when saving the object (data indices only are stored with trained models by the DnnLik and DnnLikEnsemble objects). See the DNNLikelihood object and the DNNLikelihood Ensemble object objects for more information.

  • type: dict with the following structure:

    • “X_train” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype equal to Data.dtype_required)

      Numpy array with current training dataset X points.

    • “Y_train” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype equal to Data.dtype_required)

      Numpy array with current training dataset Y points.

    • “X_val” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype equal to Data.dtype_required)

      Numpy array with current validation dataset X points.

    • “Y_val” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype equal to Data.dtype_required)

      Numpy array with current validation dataset Y points.

    • “X_test” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype equal to Data.dtype_required)

      Numpy array with current test dataset X points.

    • “Y_test” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype equal to Data.dtype_required)

      Numpy array with current test dataset Y points.

    • “idx_train” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype int32)

      Numpy array with the indices of the training points inside Data.data_X and Data.data_Y.

    • “idx_val” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype int32)

      Numpy array with the indices of the validation points inside Data.data_X and Data.data_Y.

    • “idx_test” (value type: numpy.ndarray with dtype int32)

      Numpy array with the indices of the test points inside Data.data_X and Data.data_Y.

Data.data_X¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument data_X and containing a numpy array with the X data points.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • default: (npoints,ndim)

Data.data_Y¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument data_X and containing a numpy array with the x data points.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • default: (npoints,ndim)

Data.dtype_required¶

Required data type for the generation of the train/validation/test datasets. The attribute is always set to the value of the dtype input argument if not None and to "float64" if None. It represents the data type of the data stored in the attribute Data.data_dictionary.

  • type: str

Data.dtype_stored¶

Data type of the dataset stored in the Data.output_h5_file. It is set to the value of the dtype input argument if not None and to "float64" if None the first time the object is created and remains unchanged when saving/loading the Data object.

  • type: str

Data.pars_labels_auto¶

List containing parameters names automatically generated by the function utils.define_pars_labels_auto. All parameters of interest are named r"$\theta_{i}$" with i ranging between one to the number of parameters of interest and all nuisance parameters are named r"$\nu_{j}$" with j ranging between one to the number of nuisance parameters. Parameters labels are always used as “raw” strings (like, for instance, r"%s"%pars_labels_auto[0]) and can contain latex expressions that are properly compiled when making plots.

  • type: list

  • shape: (ndims,)

Data.input_file¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument input_file. Whenever this attribute is not None, it is used to reconstructed the object from input files (see the Data.__init__ method for details).

  • type: str or None

Data.input_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file containing a saved Data object log (see the Data.save_log method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute Data.input_file. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

Data.input_object_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing a saved Data object (see the Data.save_object_h5 method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute Data.input_file. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

Data.input_samples_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing saved Data samples corresponding to the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y attribures (see the Data.save_samples_h5 method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute Data.input_file. When the latter is None, the attribute is set to None.

  • type: str or None

Data.load_on_RAM¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument load_on_RAM. If True all data available in the HDF5 dataset Dara.input_h5_file are loaded into the RAM for faster generation of train/validation/test data. If False the HDF5 file is open in read mode and train/validation/test data are generated on demand.

  • type: str or None

Data.log¶

Dictionary containing a log of the Data object calls. The dictionary has datetime strings as keys and actions as values. Actions are also dictionaries, containing details of the methods calls.

  • type: dict

  • keys: datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]

  • values: dict with the following structure:

    • “action” (value type: str)

      Short description of the action. possible values: "created", "loaded", "saved", "updated data dictionary", "computed sample weights", "defines scalers".

    • “data” (value type: list of str)

      List of keys of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary corresponding to values (data) that have been updated.

    • “npoints train” (value type: int)

      Number of training points available in the updated Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

    • “npoints val” (value type: int)

      Number of validation points available in the updated Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

    • “npoints test” (value type: int)

      Number of test points available in the updated Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

    • “scaler X” (value type: bool)

      When defining scalers it indicates if X points have been scaled.

    • “scaler Y” (value type: bool)

      When defining scalers it indicates if Y points have been scaled.

    • “file name” (value type: str)

      File name of file involved in the action.

    • “file path” (value type: str)

      Path of file involved in the action.

    • “files names” (value type: list of str)

      List of file names of files involved in the action.

    • “files paths” (value type: list of str)

      List of paths of files involved in the action.

Data.name¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument name and containing the name of the Data object. If None is passed, then name is assigned the value model_" + datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_data", while if a string is passed, the "_data" suffix is appended (preventing duplication if it is already present). It is used to generate output files names.

  • type: str

Data.ndims¶

Number of dimensions of the X data (i.e. number of parameters entering in the logpdf). It is automatically set to the length of the first vector in the input argument data_X.

  • type: int

Data.npoints¶

Number of X/Y data. It is automatically set to the length of the the input argument data_X.

  • type: int

Data.opened_dataset¶

Opened HDF5 dataset. When importing data with the Data.load_on_RAM attribute set to False the HDF5 dataset is kept open until it is manually close with the Data.close_opened_dataset method.

  • type: HDF5 file object

Data.output_folder¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument output_folder. If the latter is None, then Data.output_folder is set to the code execution folder. If the folder does not exist it is created by the utils.check_create_folder function.

  • type: str

Data.output_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file where the Data object log is saved (see the Data.save_log method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute Data.output_folder.

  • type: str

Data.output_object_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file where the Data object is saved (see the Data.save_object_h5 method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute Histfactory.output_folder.

  • type: str

Data.output_samples_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file where the Data samples corresponding to the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y attribures are saved (see the Data.save_samples_h5 method for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute Histfactory.output_folder.

  • type: str

Data.pars_bounds¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument pars_bounds and containing a numpy array with the parameters bounds. If the input argument is None then bounds for all parameters are set to [-np.inf,np.inf].

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,2)

Data.pars_central¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument pars_central and containing a numpy array with the central values of the parameters. If the input argument is None then central values for all parameters are set to 0.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,)

Data.pars_labels¶

List corresponding to the input argument pars_labels. If the input argument is None then Data.pars_labels is set equal to the automatically generated Data.pars_labels_auto. Parameters labels are always parsed as “raw” strings (like, for instance, r"%s"%pars_labels[0]) and can contain latex expressions that are properly compiled when making plots.

  • type: list

  • shape: (ndims,)

Data.pars_pos_nuis¶

Numpy array corresponding to the input argument pars_pos_nuis.

  • type: list or numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_nuis,)

Data.pars_pos_poi¶

Numpy array corresponding to the input argument pars_pos_poi.

  • type: list or numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_poi,)

Data.test_fraction¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument test_fraction. It specifies the fraction of data that is used as test set. The first (1-test_fraction) fraction of points will be used to generate train and validation data while the remaining test_fraction to generate test data.

Data.test_range¶

Attribute set from the Data.test_fraction attribute and containing the range of test data indices in the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y numpy arrays.

Data.train_range¶

Attribute set from the Data.test_fraction attribute and containing the range of train/validation data indices in the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y numpy arrays.

Data.verbose¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument verbose. It represents the verbosity mode of the Data.__init__ method and the default verbosity mode of all class methods that accept a verbose argument. See Verbosity mode.

  • type: bool or int
